docs.lead_paragraph: For journalists, climate science can be a challenge in and of itself. The uncertainties, the dueling algorithms, the long horizons involved in predicting how climate change could unfold - all of this conspires against a reporter trying to report the relevant news in a clear and accessible way.
docs.abstract: At a conference of 1,600 researchers, a participant offers a shorthand of his own: F.H.S.W.T.B.C.K.T.O.A.T.A., or "For heaven's sake, who the bleep can keep track of all these?"

headline.main: For Climate Scientists, a Dive Into Alphabet Soup

docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS | Like so many of the operas that appear on the Parisian stage and the Vespas that overrun French avenues, this city's most widespread end-of-summer fête has Italian origins.

docs.lead_paragraph: ON Halloween 2004, a block party on a street of houses rented to students at the University of Colorado ended with people in costumes running through the streets of the University Hill neighborhood, throwing bottles, setting fires and overturning cars. Police in riot gear used rubber bullets and stun guns to disperse more than 1,500 people, a huge crowd in this city of 103,000, which has a reputation for tranquil mountain living. For nonstudents living on the Hill -- a historic neighborhood bordering the university where million-dollar Craftsman-style homes sit next to student rentals with yards full of plastic cups and empty beer cans -- it was only the latest, most visible example of a conflict that had simmered for years.

headline.main: Students Letting Off Steam Leave the Neighbors Steaming

docs.snippet: In towns around the country, permanent residents share sidewalks with their student neighbors in a sometimes shaky peace....

docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN Norm and Diane Wells set out to renovate their buff-toned brick house here, they didn't go shopping at the Home Depot. Instead, they spent two years building a stockpile. It consisted of things like weathered picnic tables from a mountain overlook, which they turned into stairs, oak flooring from an Air Force base, a paneled oak door that had greeted geology students at the University of Colorado and molded resin doors hung in a 1960's design firm (bits of orange shag carpet were still stuck to the bottom edges when Mr. Wells brought them home).
docs.abstract: Deconstruction, latest recycling drive making its way across country, uses castoffs from houses being demolished; materials are in good condition, but do not fit with style of renovation and are trashed; many nonprofit groups collect and sell salvaged building materials, plowing profits back into their causes; photos (M)

headline.main: Salvage Décor, Ready for Its Close-Up
